page.title: 03Decca Navigator Co. Ltd.
page.content: The masts of the{Decca station}on the heights above Bouley Bay, form part of the network of{Government } {financed}stations that cover the seaways around Britain. The stations are so sited in threes (arranged more or less at the points of an equlateral triangle and a hundred or so miles apart) with a main staion at the central point of the triangle that their radio signals allow ships with {special receiving sets}to position themselves very accurately using phase differences in the signals from the {master}and{slave}stations. {Jersey}is a{slave}station (along with one on the Scillies and in South Wales) to the master near Start Point in Devon. {Other countries}(Holland, Denmark and Norway) are part of the system.
